text: 500ml can dated May 25th. Pours hazy pale amber with small white head. Nose malty and slightly fruity. Light spices. Fairly shy. Taste spicy and fruity with light alcohol. Quite smooth and malty. Finish spicy and fruity. Not the hoppy bomb I was expecting. Makes me wonder if this can is off...
Had right after Julius and dig Julius just a touch more. There is similar citrus orange juice here with a finish that is a touch more bitter. Same hazy orange color. Delicious either way.

Two cans one 5 weeks old the other two weeks old. Alter Ego is more my jam than Julius and even green - and doppelganger is a great imperial on this. Dank, velvety and brighter than Julius and green. Count me as team Alter ego.

16 oz can shared by voodoofish75. Pours a hazy golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have juicy citrus, orange, tangerine, light onion, slight herbal notes, just a hint of citrus peel, some bitterness to the finish with this solid.

Tree House Alter Ego. Explosão aromática, com corpo aveludado. Mosaic na cara. 4.25/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can at home. Pours hazy orange with a two finger thick white head. Smooth with lots of citrus, some tropical fruits, mostly mango and pineapple, and a bit of grass.

[1/27/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Cloudy yellow. Fruity hops, oniony, dry, some unpleasant cucumber notes. Not really my thing. 7/3/6/3/12=3.1
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Fruity hops, a bit oniony. Dry, bitter. Good. 7/3/7/3/15=3.5
Not my favorite from treehouse, but definitely a good beer. Not quite as smooth as their others.
Pours a hazy golden orange from the can with thin wispy white head that leaves light lace. Aroma of dank huge tropical hop notes. Taste follows, lupulin in your face, wow. Hops on hops, nice.

Pours a very murky, peach-orange, with middling head. Strong citrus and hop aromas. Flavor is very juicy, with citrus and tropical fruit, hop bite, and just a touch of sweetness to round it all out. Outstanding beer!

Can... This beer rocks! Cloudy pear-colored pour with golden/orange highlights and a small, brief, white head. The aroma features huge citrus fruit notes - both tangerines and oranges - accompanied by a light muskiness. Medium to full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is bittersweet, citrusy and bright. Great balance of fruity sweetness, tartness and pithy bitterness. Lightly citric and moderately bitter in the finish. Kudos to landhoney for providing the can of this world-class brew!

Pours hazy apricot with a fair eggshell head. Aroma presents woody hoppy and tart citrus notes. Flavor features evergreenish hops, tangy citrus and fresh malt notes. Mouthfeel delivers OK body and plenty of fizz. Alter your ego.
Can. Golden hazy pour with white head. Herbal, grassy and mild citrus hop aromas. Flavors are hop forward, herbal and grassy tones.
Can etched - pours gold white head - nose and taste of cut grass, toasted grain, citrus peel - medium body

Growler fill from the source via a friend. Filled 12/29/16. Two days fresh. Pours hazy tree house orange, white head. Aroma is orange juice, mango, grapefruit, pineapple, papaya, just perfect. Flavor is peach, orange juice, pine, dankness, mosaic hops. So good. One of the best beers out there. As good a beer as TH makes.

Poured a hazy orange color with a white head. Aroma was of oranges and lots of melons and green vegetal hops. Flavor similar, hopped to abundamce with not much individual hop character to show, but still tasty and crushable.

Can courtesy of Reynolds314, thanks! Shared with Kenny and Paul. Slightly hazy golden color, white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is lightly bittersweet citrus and tropical fruit. Pleasant and nicely balanced, flavors come together well.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 16oz can. Pours hazy, almost opaque, orange-ish gold with a medium off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit, bread, pine, caramel, more indistinct citrus, and grass. Taste is dull grapefruit, dough, vague mango, earth, and some resin. Moderate bitterness. Harsh aftertaste of resin-y pine that wont quit. Medium body. Moderate, prickly carbonation. Slick, almost pillowy mouthfeel.

Can three weeks old shared at the Hoppy Pub. 
Really hazy yellow - orange with a creamy white head. Amazing fruity, juicy and citrus aroma, with some hints of pine. Taste is like having a fresh squeezed juice of citrus, orange, pineapple infused with fresh squeezed hops. So good. Easy drinkable and so addicting . Great IPA.

Dark hazy orange and juicy as expected. Heavier on the palate, and not as clean when compared side by side to Trillium. As with Julius, a lovely beer that I think is overrated as a very top of the heap IPA. Top 50? Yes. Top 3? Not to me. Big n juicy with tropical fruit and citrus peel, more bitterness than Julius but not a lot. Between 4.2 and 4.3 on this one.

Generously gifted to me--can from brewery. Consumed in an IPA glass. If this was a blind taste test, I would say just an ok IPA. I may have had a corrupted palate as I enjoyed Sap just before this one.

Pours cloudy gold with medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma is big time tropical citrus, earthy and floral...all hops. Taste is bittersweet. Smooth and almost oily texture, excellent again. I could drink this all day every day.

Pours a muddy caramel with an off-white head. Nose is fruit-forward and hoppy -- apple, mango, banana. Mouth is sweet then quite quickly bitter, with lots of fruits giving way to a wall of hop dryness. Not as soft as Julius, which is nice actually - this has a bit more of an edge. Some spices even, with maybe cloves and cinnamon. But subtle. Good, I might like it a bit more than Julius.

Pours a murky golden, orange, red, and brown color? The head was soapy that laced my glass. The aroma is full of citrus, floral, and mild spicy hops. There is a subtle mango orange like tic tac aroma with a faint hint of booze. Tasting is of sugary malts, noticeable citrus, and very clean bitterness. This beverage balances extremely well. It has a good body and a great aftertaste that mimic the flavor. Overall a wonderful drinkable brew to obtain.

Hazy, turbid, glowing orange with a fingers worth of head. Aroma of orange peel, citrus, light grassy tones. Taste is of candied orange peel, pineapple, grapefruit, floral, nice bready malt. Medium body, pillowy mouthfeel, and a rounded bitterness. Great IPA but I prefer Green and Julius.

Thanks to Kev for this. Pours cloudy golden yellow with a moderate white pillow. Aroma is grapefruit, mango and pineapple hop juice. Taste is a nice citrus, grapefruit punch in the mouth, light resin and dankness. More juicy like but not Julius juice. Stays on the palate, well after very nice.

Can at the cellar Chester... Thanks to the staff... Murky Amber.. M thin white lacing..... Juicy floral orange passion fruit nose... Zesty orange.. Juicy fruit... Big passion.... Juicy sweet fruit.. Zesty orange fruit

Can into a wineglass showing unfiltered and opaque dark orange with a finger of quickly dissipating clean white foam. 

The nose shows intense grapefruit with light hints of mango and a malty background. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Flavors of intensely juicy grapefruit throughout and a final grapefruit pulpy and zesty bitterness. Completely dry and in combination with the zestiness and carbonation makes this perfect. Very clearly no addition of any juices. This is masterfully made.

Very hazy, one finger off-White head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, mango and peach, little pine
Taste: big mouthful, citrus, peach, very long aftertaste, fantastic beer.

Can, poured into a tasting glass. Very hazy light gold color with a fluffy off-white head that breaks into decent lace. Aroma of cat litter, passion fruit, fresh cut grass, lemongrass and some melon. Taste is not as balanced as regular Julius, but still enjoyable with tons of late-edition hop juice. Moderate bitterness, but still getting a tiny bit of astringency in the end. Tropical meets Citrus fruits....fun beer, but Julius hits the spot for me.

Big appearance, hop aroma, creamy, and tremendously complex ipa.
Can from Marten, very good hoppy ale. Very crushable.
Can. Pour is filthy,, cloudy gold with a soapy white head. Aroma is citrusy, floral, And spicy. Flavor is also Citrusy and floral With some dry Notes. Tasty.
Tasting at Eugenes, canCloudy blond color. The aroma is spicy, resiny, piney. Similar flavor; it has moderate sweetness too.Very good.

Tons of citrus and mango in the nose. Thick velvet texture and an amazingly smooth mouthfeel. Taste same as aroma with a very light bitterness, way below the level youd expect from the amount of hops implied here. Amazingly balanced, smooth and drinkable beer.

Hazy peach color with off-white head. Aroma is really dank and juicy with tropical fruits and chives. Taste starts juicy up-front, full of stone fruits, citrus fruits. Some light bitterness on the finish with lingering grapefruit flavor. Light to medium body with crisp carbonation. One of the best IPAs I ever had.

from a can...Isnt there a Phil Collins album cover that has the same font and Carribean Sea color as this design? Anyhoo, pop the top and the fruity orangy nectar wrestles you to submission. Palate is medium weight and the for the style the gravity is heavy. Taste is alkili, and a prelude to a screwdriver, shall I add a fantastic journey of peppery-piney-juicy lovliness. 
Well, well, that about sums this one up 4 me.
GROWLER shared in Bucharest. Murky bright yellow. Full on tart fruit and dank hop juice. Fruity juice flavour, peaches, no real malts. Moderate, soft piney bitterness, no zesty spice. Excellent.

this is as good as an ipa gets. Aroma is mango and orange. flavor is juicy, mango sweet with just a slight bitter hop finish. pours hazy orange, looks like orange juice. had a can pour at home. thanks craig!

Dank dank dank! Deep gold pour, good sized head. Dank aroma, grass and mango. Liquid weed in the taste. Mango, melon, grassy, stone fruit. Medium body. If in doubt refer back to the first 3 words of this review.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 Crazy cloudy orange. Dank, citrus, and melon on the nose. Soft, creamy mouthfeel. Subtle spicy hop finish. Citrus hops. Delicious and so poundable.

Oh jeez! In the line for Blåbær 2016! Pours a murky multi fruit juice yellowish with a creamy white head. Aroma has spicy, crisp, fresh amarillo-like hops, upon a citrussy fruityness and the wheaty, honeylike, floral New England yeast/malt base. Taste is less sweet than the other beers ive had in this style. Much more crisp, but still with a rather low bitterness. Really really good! Average carbonation and a smooth, crisp body.

Can @ Monkish. Murky copper colored beer with a short lived white head. Really a surprisingly resinous and oily hop character here, despite still having quite a bit of pineapple, orange, and apricot juiciness. Theres a pretty dank aroma and bitterness, actually. An underlying malt sweetness to it as well. Its not what I would usually expect for this kind of new wave IPA.
Can shared by Nick. Pours hazy amber with a big white head. Notes of dank hops, melons, pineapple, sweet orange, citrussy.
Sample @ Blåbær 16, from can. Cloudy dark golden with a generous head. Notes of citrus, orange zest, lemon, grape fruit, juicy stone fruits and a light bitterness.
Very cloudy dark orange. Spicy aroma. Herbal and sweet. Doesnt smell great. Dense. Thick mouthfeel. Caramel and sugar. Woodsy with pine bark and peaches. Not a fan of this one either.

Can, 1 pint. Hazy golden/amber with a foamy offwhite head. Sharp aromas of tropical hops, caramel, resin. Medium to full bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth and oily. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Exquisite roasted and hoppy character.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy amber beer with a medium size white head. Aroma is of floral hops, pine and citrics, mainly orange zest. Taste is bitter with moderate sweetness. Medium bodied with some carbonation. Nice bitter hoppy finish with a long astringent aftertaste.
Pours fuzzy blonde, OK white head. Smell is very fruity, pineapple, tropical . Taste is bitter, full, sharp, grainy back. Very intense !

Can from Tom Bailey. Thanks, brother. Pours cloudy beige to tan with foam that lingers. Aroma is Valencia oranges, sweet malt, and soft hops. Taste is similar with a beautiful mild pith quality. Finish is a huge tangerine and candied grapefruit. Great stuff.

Pours a cloudy dark orange colour with thick white head. Aroma consists of tangerine, pine, herbs and onion-like dank note. Taste is very fruity. Tropical fruit and grapefruit with grassy character and medium to low bitterness. Mild malty flavour in finishing.

Tasted from can. Pours a super murky dark orange with white head. Aroma is pineapple, melon, mango, grapefruit, lemon. Big time fruity aroma. Taste is supremely well balanced. Flavors similar to nose with lots of citrus and tropical fruits along with some herbal elements and a little pine. Incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

64 oz. growler shared by Matthew. Served alongside Julius. Many thanks!

Hazy yellowish body with a small white cap. The aroma, like Julius, is otherworldly. Simply phenomenal. When I imagine an ideal IPA, its these two. A cornucopia of fresh, juicy, resinous hops and tropical fruits. So quaffable as to be dangerous. Perfection.

Can. The pour is a hazy deep orange. The aroma is fruity hops, nice. The taste is certainly that of a pale ale. Good, but I was expecting more, a bit over hyped. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared at Belgian Chimipalooza, thanks! Very hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of fresh fruity hops, citrus, tropical and orange peel. Flavour is light sweet and moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Pours hazy orange with a medium white head with excellent retention great carbonation. AROMA: orange, coriander, herbs, floral, lightly spiced, herbal hops, caramel, citrus zest, crystal malt, leaves, slight stone fruit, grassy bitterness, dank, pine resin, grapefruit, hay, light peppercorns and honey. TASTE: orange, coriander, herbs, floral, lightly spiced, herbal hops, caramel, citrus zest, malty, leaves, grassy bitterness, dank, pine, grapefruit, hay, light peppercorns and honey. AFTER TASTE: caramel, dank citrus, coriander, herbs and hop resin with an oily yet tangy bitter citrus lightly spiced finish.
Pours a murky orange juice in color with a sparce white lacing. The aroma is citrus, grapefruit and orange rind. The flavor is mostly dry but finishes somewhat sweet. Some alcohol shines through
Can shared at Todds. Hoppy and light body with haze and citrus tropical fruit. Crisp.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Can: The aroma consists of big citrus, tropical fruits, and faint dank hops. Its pours a cloudy dull orangish-yellow with a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of moderate citrus and tropical fruits. The finish has moderate grapefruit and light dank hops. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.
Can thanks to Jeff! Aroma is super juicy and dank tropical fruit. Tastes the same basically but I love it. Nothing complex at all but I could slam this every day.
Super fruity. Alot of turbidity. Tropical fruit. Easy to drink. Thx thepatrickman
Not fair, not fair. This beer borders IPA perfection. Its the "juice" that most other breweries around here try to get. Never cloying, still drinkable to the end. An improvement on Julius? Perhaps.

Tulip from can. Pour is a cloudy apricot orange with a pillowy white head that hangs around a bit and leaves great lacing. Aroma is full of tropical and citrus fruit. Mango, pineapple, papaya, orange juice, tangerine, and passion fruit, as well as some sweet caramel. Taste is full of tropical flavors up front. Mango, passion fruit, and papaya big time. Tons of oranges and some grapefruit. There is some dank pine as well as a bit of caramel in the background. Creamy and very juicy. Outstanding.
From a can into a glass. The pour is a cloudy dark yellow with a white head. This is a great ipa with a floral citrus and apple.

Appearance cloudy
Aroma floral/piney slight hop note
Taste- floral piny IPA. Well balanced and stronger compared to a traditional American IPA. Very good but not as good as treehouse's DIPAs. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler from brewery. Pours hazy gold. Aroma is tropical fruit, light citrus peel, light pale malts, and faint floral notes. Flavor is smooth and delicious with rich, fruity hop flavors with a moderate amount of bitterness that fades into a clean, dry finish. Medium body.

Cloudy yellow with medium white head. Grassy and citrus hop aroma. Medium body, lightly carbonated. Medium bitter flavor, mostly citrus, grassy flavors, some yeast at the end. Very nice. Maybe like the Julius a little more but its close.

Can courtesy of rlgk. Pours very hazy deep tiny reddish yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves lots of spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity and tiny grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, fleshy mango, fleshy papaya, pineapple, green grapes, freshly cut grass, pine needles and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, very tiny sour, heavy fruity and medium bodied. Mouthfeel is soft, slightly dry, very tiny tart and medium bodied. Finish is tiny bitter, heavy dank and heavy fruity. Insane dank fruity hop profile. Love it!
Pours hazy amber with a small off white head. Aroma is fruity hoppy citric. Flavor is very nice indeed, lots of tropical fruits citrus pungent hops.
Hazy golden. Tropical, citric and herbal. White bread. Medium to heavily bitter and dry. Light acidic. Juice ft and herbal. Soft with medium carbonation. Medium bodied.
A: Peach coloured with a white head N: Mango, papaya, lime T: Pine, mango, grapefruit O: Quite bitter but its nice!

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Hazy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy citrus and pine aroma, peach, passion fruits, tangerines, orange zest, cedar, fruit cocktail, some grapes. Hoppy peach and passion fruit, citrus, tangerines, pine, grapes, hop juice, some pine apples. Amazing beer, totally fresh hop juice!

Can. Pours golden orange hazy with off white head. Aroma is Citrus grapefruit Orange with a little spiciness. Taste is sweet grapefruit orange tangerine with a dry bitter fruity pine finish. Excellent.

Can, picked up from Tree House earlier the same day. Drinking this without reading the notes from the brewery I thought it tasted really similar to Lights On and was a pale ale, so Im surprised to see that its a riff on Julius. All of the normal Tree House notes -- creamy and smooth, hoppy, little bitterness -- but it felt a bit restrained, like a pale ale.

Can

Nose has fresh woord, bark and acidy pine to it, along with a hint of grape peel. 

Juicy, whole bodied with an amazingly dissapearing character. Your glass is just empty suddenly, thats how smooth it is! Close to no more bitternes than what absolutely just rounds it off.
16oz can thanks to Steve. pours out a hazy gold topped with a small sand head. nose is grapefruit citrus hops leafy hop and a big malt. Taste is more of the grapefruit citrus hops and a sweet malt.

Do I really need to say something. I think nuff has been said. Lovely smooth, tasty, balanced and refreshing hop juice! Medicine to your soul and body.Lovely clear orange golden color with solid thick off white head that last all the way. Solid lacing also. Prima ballerina perfect look. Holy hop juice aroma with grapefruit, pine and mild tropical fruits. Nice intensity. Medium (+) body and a fine carbonation. Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness. Grapefruit hoppy, mild tropical, pine and a fine mellow mild malt base in the back. Holy water![Can from a trade with RobertDale]
Dank, fruity aroma. Pours light, smooth head. Cloudy/ murky orange color. Very hoppy with fruit and pine. Drinkable and enjoyable.

Very dank, in your face aroma, even from a can. Drank from can, not sure about appearance. Tastes balanced of bitter and sweet, dank dank dank marijuana oregano. Overall, very very good. Thanks Nate for giving me a sip ;).

2-18-16 batch. Minimal lacing or head. Deep fruit notes and golden amber color. Mostly opaque. Nice hoppy fruit blast up front. Rolls into a nice dry and somewhat malty finish. Incredibly balanced and drinkable. Similar to Julius in a lot of ways, yet unique and perhaps more bitter and up front at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can at home, thanks to a trade, drank during SB50. Oranges, exotic fruits, very juicy, bitter. Easy drinikable. Great!

16 oz can to half-pint (shared with the Mrs; thanks Kerry!). Looks good; a cloudy juice-like pineapple orange with eggshell head. Smells and tastes of juicy and bitter hops with a moderately bittersweet backbone and a pleasantly bitter medium-bodied juice-like mouthfeel. A good IPA that reminds me a bit of Jackie Os Mystic Mama, only with a juicier mouthfeel.

Can less than 3 weeks old.  Cloudy almost bright orange. Nose is piney and citrus hops, slightly green. Nose is just massive hops...like sticking my head in a bag full of my freshly picked hops from my yard. Flavor follows, great biscuity base beer and tons of juicy hops with tropical mango, some citrus, and great pine and green elements. This is as close to hops in liquid form as Ive ever had. Amazing.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is fairly juicy, with tropical fruits and citrus hops. Flavour brings out both juicy citrusy hops and mineraly notes, leaving a biscuity malt finish. Very well-balanced and thorough on the palate. Really nice.
16 oz can at Eugenes. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a lasting foam head. Bitter aroma of grassy hops. Orange fruit, big hops, Juicy finish. Pretty good IPA.

16 oz can shared with ebone1988. Got this gem from Eddie in a trade and I'm happy to share. The pour is a darker orange color with a thin white head and a lingering soapy lace. It looks pretty good. The aroma is pretty good as well. There is a lot of pine and resin bitterness. The hops are present and dank for sure. It's nicely fruity and bitter. I'm a fan. The flavor is really good. There is a great hop bitterness. The dank fruitiness brings up the rear and it's a little layered and delicious. It's juicy and lovely. The mouth feel is a little thicker and well carbonated. It's got a lingeringly juicy fruit hop that is wonderful. I'm a fan of this!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2016 Can shared with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, tropical fruit, floral, pine, great. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, white head. Taste is tons of tropical fruit, dank, floral, pine, really good. Mouthfeel is crisp carbonation and medium body, a real dank aftertaste. Overall, this is very tasty but could improve on mouthfeel.
The cans are big and works of art.The beer is amazing and bursting with flavor.So glad I live close to TH

16oz can pours cloudy opaque dark orange with a finger of head. Nose is tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus, dank. Taste is soft creamy mouthfeel, low bitterness, touch of grain, grassy orange and sticky tropical fruit. Finishes with low bitterness, creamy tropical fruit, guava, orange, pineapple. Good stuff.

Pours out a hazy golden orangy color with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma is of pine, juicy citrus fruits, earthy hops, evergreen, sap and light malty notes. Taste is complex, nice and juicy, evergreen, Pine, some juicy fruity notes, pineapple, light grapefruit, some mild earthy hops, this place can make one serious IPA. Wish it was close.

Poured from a can dated 02/13/2016. 
Aroma is rather hop forward with some nice citrus notes as well as some light tropical fruit and pine. A bit of a fresh hop pellet note with some resin. More hop oils and resin as it warms. Some light cracker notes. 
Pours a murky, copper orange with a large, thick, white head that exhibits decent retention as it recedes. High lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with some cracker malt notes that lingers in the finish and a touch of caramel. Medium high bitterness. Balanced pine and grapefruit hop notes with some orange and light tropical fruit. A bit of stone fruit with some hop pellet notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice IPA with fresh hop notes and a balanced bitterness and malt profile. Hops seemed to be a pretty traditional blend, but very fresh.
Citrus and pine aroma. Exquisite head. Super juicy. Fresh and crushable. A real competitor to Heady. Tasted at 52°F.

Even over a month old it is still juicy and hoppy! Pours thick and juicy each juice with a sandy colored head. The aroma brings tropical hop notes with a gentle loving sweetness. The flavors of light pine and smooth bitter hop root settle on the palate with a juicy body.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing!

Pours hazy orange golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting beige head. Aroma of intense fresh hops, grapefruit, mandarina, lemon. Taste of fresh bitter hops, tropical fruits, very delicious, fascinating!

475 ml can (less than one month old) at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of Eric. Hazy yellow golden color with off white head. Hoppy aroma, floral, grassy, light weedy, pine, grapefruit, tropical fruits Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body soft carbonation.

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for this can!  The beer has an intense fruity-hoppy nose. The beginning is quite mild with lots of grapefruit and green floral hops. Tropical fruits, fresh and intense with a slightly sweetish but nice neutral-enough body to let the hops stand in the foreground. Great intense fresh floral aftertaste: Pine, tropical fruits, fresh and intense hops. Great stuff!

16 oz. can from Clark. 12/9/15 Thanks! It pours a very hazy (not cloudy) orange color with a medium to large frothy off white head. The aroma explodes with lots stone and tropical fruit. Mango, melon, pineapple, papaya with some background citrus notes of grapefruit and orange. Very potent and juicy. The flavor is pretty much the same with loads of pineapple, mango, peach and melon. Light grassy astringency in the finish, no doubt from all the hops. Very light bready malt character, but the body feels rather full with some light honey and spice notes. The finish is medium to strongly bitter with more citrus, grass and tropical fruit. This beer is absolutely killer. One of the hoppiest beers Ive tried, and thats saying something.
Wow this is good. Hazed yellow. Wonderful tropical fruit flavors, lightly dank, soft and supple. Awesome.

lovely liquid lurking in my labelled glass . lush and likeable. lashes of lovely citrus and late additions. love this beer. look! lacking nothing. lets dance ladies! .. now for 27 Ls in a row. LLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL.

Can via trade thanks Dfroms.
Léger orangé trouble, col épais crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme est houblonné, fleurie t tropical, pointe de pin. Rappel de mandarine, ananas, herbacé et note de pamplemousse qui perce en rétro-nasal.
Palais est chargé de notes tropicales, fruité résiduel moyen avec un accompagnement de pin, épicé et râpeux. Agrumes et légèrement huileux sur la fin avec encore ce léger côté mandarine, fruit passion et pamplemousse plus ananas. Abricot est aussi une autre option avec un léger côté purée et jus fruité.

Can shared by a friend. Pours clear gold with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, grapefruit, tropical fruit, pine and pineapple. Malty flavor giving way to tropical fruit and cucumber before a piney hop finish.

Can thanks to bytemesis. Pours hazy burnt orange with white head, decent lacing. Dank and leafy; onion and garlic; a bit tannic (think: tea). Moderately sweet, appreciably bitter. Medium body, oily texture. Long lasting mouth-coating bitter finish. Overall: tasty, but I strongly prefer green.

21/XI/15 - 1Pt. can @ Gentse Biervereniging: Grote Westvleteren Degustatie - BB: n/a (2015-1640) Thanks to PriorL for sharing the can!
Cloudy orange beer, small to almost no head, off-white. Aroma: yes! This is the good stuff!! Lots of pineapple, bit resinous, grapefruit, lychee, citrus, bit funky (cheesy?). MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: citrus, fruity start, piny, resinous, some sweet malts, pretty bitter. Aftertaste: resinous, bitter, fruity notes, grapefruit, pineapple, grassy, some caramel and malts in the back.

Fresh cans, only a few days old, drunk 12/11/15.Ok, so I was very suspicious of the whole New England cloudy IPA thing when it first started being a thing at HF, Tree House and Trillium. It just seems so anti what a good pale ale should be; these arent hefeweizens, after all. But 2 years later, whatever the case, Im a believer. And to go even farther than that, Trilliums recent "clarity problem", the problem being that their pales and ipas are now nearly clear, is actually concerning. As it seems like there has been a drop in quality that has come exactly with this new clarity. Of course, maybe the two things are completely unrelated, but I dont think so....Anyways, thats a very long-winded way of saying how much I appreciate the heavily hazy character still found at Tree House. Alter Ego is a very sunset-hued, hazy orange-golden beer with a small white head and moderate retention.Melon, pineapple, stonefruits, juicy tangerine, pretty much all the best characteristics these hops have to offer and little/none of the bad stuff. No punch/tang, no resin, no green onion (or very minimal, at most). Light biscuits and honey from the malt, which is delicately done and plays only a small role, as it should. No alcohol or flaw.Flavor follows suit. Bright citrus, dank, leafy, green notes, tropical fruits and a lingering, heavily retronasal watermelon note. Perfect attenuation and balance with a good, but not overdone bitterness. This, like most of the other beers at Tree House, is some of the very best beer being brewed on this planet. Always a treat! Cheers to Nate and the rest of the gang. (Also the guy a few reviews down that says this "dosent hold up to Julius" should definitely go ahead and read up on what this beer is.....)

Nose of pale malt white sugar sweaty tropical mosaic hops. Hazy orange golden pour nice head. Flavors of dough tropical fruit white sugar bread alcohol. Tropical dank veggies linger. Nice carbonation. Good mouthfeel.

Can 473ml. Thx Huxxy, sry MC.
Pours hazy golden with high beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, flowers, yuzu, clean, fresh, menthol., juicy white grapes. Taste is of citrus, bitterness, pine, juice. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Awesome balance. Overall: Very good. Clean. Awesome hops. Oustanding. Its been a long time since Ive had something this good.

pours hazy/cloudy golden orange with a small creamy white cap, nice lacing. minty citrus - fragrant exotic lemon, melons and mangoes, onions, dill, doughy and cushy maltiness - clean. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily; smooth, juicy and balanced spicy-citrusy finish. intensely aromatic and complex - liked it a tad more than julius. yup.

Juicy aroma with big a bit more yeasty esters and passionfruit forward, very much so a like Julius but a bit more melon and passionfruit, also a bit more grass. Feels like the yeast comes through more. A bit stronger fragnance and a bit more aggressive than Julius, I prefer this.

Aroma is a blast of fruit juices, Appearance is a beautiful very opaque orange color with a fluffy white head, taste is an explosion of fruit juice with bitterness mid mouth and finish with juice, palate is very creamy with nice carbonation, overall a delicious well balanced beer.

fresh can, canned on 19th nov. same recipe as julius, but with the use of other hops. pour is just as julius, so deep hazy trouble dark golden to more orange colour with a nice white fluffy head on top. nose of sweet dried peaches and stone fruit pits, nectarines, grass, slight herbal grass, harsh, papaya, candied fruit, sweet fruit pulp. light sweet fruit juice in the taste. but with a nice and complex harsh bitterness to it. wheats and some crispy malts. very tropical fruit taste. lots of exotic fruits instead of the orange in julius. mouthfeel is just incredible and creamy. slightly dry, overall this is similar to julius, but with more exotic papaya fruits. when i thought julius cant get better... this just blew me away! tree house is incredible! so so good

Can, received as a very generous extra, in a trade with Leighton. Cheers! Murky gold. Film and halo of sticky, just off white head. Nose has nicely dank, luscious, tropical fruit hop. Some strawberry and vanilla malts. Background notes of orange pith and resinous pine. Taste is juicy sweet, turning pithy, and resinous bitter. Soft chew on the palate. Finishes long, pithy, and zesty bitter. Leaves a nice stickiness on the lips. Lovely.
Can to glass. Pours a light orange color with an off white head. Very nice tropical fruit, slightly piney hop character. Overall an outstanding IPA, but doesnt hold up to Julius or Green!

Golden colored body, medium sized white head, and nice soapy lacing. Nice blend of citrus and tropical juice backed by some nice dank and pine notes. Medium bodied, dry throughout, moderate carbonation, lively bitterness, juicy finish.

Pours cloudy golden color with off white heard. Aroma is citrus, shaved coconut, and dank tropical fruits. Flavor is tropical fruit, pineapple,an citrus with a dank hoppy finish. Amazing dank aroma and finish.

Can (1 pint) at home. Split 2-ways with the lady. Muchas gracias al señor Huxley para esta cerveza! Hazy bright golden-orange ala Hill Farmstead with a medium white head, some retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is a burst of dank and juicy hops alongside a ton of orange, mild piney notes a tiny bit of spiciness. Taste is also pretty juicy and dank with orange being dominang, lean maltiness, mild spiciness and moderate bitterness. Medium body. Medium to good carbonation. Mouthfeel is silky, borderline creamy which give a nice effect with the orange flavor being so present. Beautiful IPA combining the best of dankness, juiciness and orange along with a great mouthfeel. Easy drinking. Tasty stuff!

16oz can shared by John! Huge thanks bro! Poured a dirty unfiltered burnt orange color with a thick frothy white head. Aroma is all dank citrus and tropical fruits! Wow! Taste is equally as insane! Tons of juicy dank citrus and tropical fruit, ripe pineapple, citrus zest, and some grass. Super juicy! So good!!

Can shared. Glowing hazy gold pour with white head. Aroma is super dank, fruity, dank, juicy hop aromas, orange, orange creamsicle. Taste is lightly bitter, very juicy, pungent hops. Palate is med-full bodied, silky with good carb, quite creamy. Delicious.

Thx to PriorL & Mathieu87. Can sampled @ "De grote Black Tuesday  Tasting".They recently purchased this one @ the brewery so this one should be FRESH. Mango hazy orange, creamy solid white head. Very dank nose, bitter with mango peel, lots of it & light passionfruit sweetness. Taste is dank, thick creamy yeast, orange & more orange peel, more straightforward than the Green which I tried prior to this one. Body is thick yeast smoothie. Bit too yeasty for me but overall nice. A very fashionable modern style USA IPA, slightly reminiscent of what Trillium makes.

Small, just yellowish head over hazy orange beer. Grapey, fruity hops, and a faint acidity suggested. Dry-bitterish taste; bit leathery. Fruity flavours as from grapefruit and passion fruit. Light body; spritzy carbonation. Quite OK.  Txs to the Vermeersch bros!

Can share on the 42nd floor, many thanks to Leighton. Hazy orange, small foamy white head, light lacing. Aroma is passionfruit, tangerine, rubber. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is flowery, leafy hops, passionfruit, rubber with some dry cardboard in the finish. Dirty Mosaic showcase. Nice stuff.
Cloudy Amber gold little white head ; aroma is mildly hoppy; flava is very hoppy notes of citrus and wood; feels medium lively foamy fizz; finishes bitter and tangy some tartness

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015  November 2, 2015. Can at home, canned september 23, 2015. Received in a trade with Leighton, thanks! 
Cloudy orange with a large, slowly dissipating, white head leaving a nie lacing on the glass. Aroma is lots of juicy tropical fruits with pineapple, peach, orange, tangerine, some pine and resin. 
Taste is medium sweet fruity and medium bitter. Finish is sweet orange, peach, hints of mango with a piney and citrus pith zest bitterness. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation, quite creamy texture. 
Another great juicy hoppy beer from Tree House

Thanks many times to Will for the can! Pours a cloudy honey color with a cream colored head. The smell is pineapple, tropical fruit, very juicy. The taste is big and juicy, plenty of orange rind, tropical fruit some citrus ending dry and crisp. The body is light+ with fine carbonation.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Thanks to Leighton. Hazy orange - gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry, mild fine carbonation. Mildly sweet malts, a little cream. Skunky hops. Dry orange leads to hop spice. Tropical fruits. Light and hop skunky finish. Very nice.

Can split at the 42nd floor Tasting, big thanks to Leighton, 08/10/15.
Hazed orange amber with a decent beige covering. 
Nose is pine needle, dank hop strokes, citric tinged straw, bitter orange, apricot. 
Taste comprises skunky hop tunes, pine resin, grapefruit, bitter orange shreds, earthy tones.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close. 
Solid dank hop affair.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Hazed bright golden / orange coloured pour with a lasting off light creamy head. Aroma is big dank hop, lemon, dishcloth. Flavour is composed of of solid biscuity Base malt, orange, rind. Palate is velvety, medium bodied, some sticky sweet, moderate carbonation. Very juicy, really good.

Can. Opaque apricot color pour with a white head. Really tasty with tropical fruit highlights. Mild bitterness from the grapefruity hops. Nice balance with plenty of caramel malty notes. Really good body and mouthfeel.

Can at the 42nd floor tasting, big thanks to Leighton! It pours cloudy gold with a medium white head. The nose is toasty, brioche, fresh pine, light varnish, dankness, passion fruit and mango. The taste is bitter, grassy, dank, toasty stuff, pine, grapefruit, orange, tangerine and light spice with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. So very well-rounded and drinks incredibly easily. Delicious.

Growler from this afternoon. Pours a murky, amber-tinted orange with a fluffy white head. Smells of fruity hops. Lots of citrus, orange, stone fruit. Juicy, fruity taste. Slight apparent sweetness up front followed by a light to light+ bitterness. Far from a bitter IPA. Texture is almost creamy initially; carbonation is on the soft side of average; medium bodied; lightly bitter finish.

50cl can at the 42nd level tasting, London. Big thanks to Leighton for this serious hopper. It pours a cloudy golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is full of skunk, black pepper, grapefruit, grass. Taste is medium sweet with melon, skunk, peach, apricot, grass citrus. Medium to full bodied with soft to good carbonation. Overall, awsome
This is pretty exceptional, but then most everything Ive tasted from them thus far has been. There is real depth here.

Can shared in London - picked up in a trade. Pours hazy gold with a big, frothy white head. Lovely aroma, big peach, melon, tangerine, dank pine. Medium sweet flavor with salty melon, tangerine, low bitterness, meaty orange. Pale bread. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Resinous finish, more peach and tangerine, light dank sweat, melon, mango. A little bitterness in the aftertaste. Superlative stuff.
Beautiful orange pour. Nose is onion, fresh orange juice, well water. Taste is oranges, spicy, bittering hops, a touch of alcohol, somewhat harsh bitter finish.
16 ounce can. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and pine. Taste is lemon, orange, pine, floral, and malt. Very, very good.
Can shared by Bruce. Pours orange with white head. Earthy aroma. Taste is pine and citrus. Mosaic hops dominate the flavor.

Can shared by my friend Bruce. Pours hazy golden with a thick white head and a light citrus aroma. There is an earthy pale malt flavor embued with Mosaic hoppiness. There is a nice hop profile, but not as clean and balanced as the base beer, Julius.

Aroma: Garlic, Veggie, Dank

Appearance: Dark Hazy Orangish Hue, Passes Minimal Light, White Head Ring, Sticky Lacing

Taste: Garlic, Dank, Juicy Citrus Nuggets, Mild Veggie

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying, Mildly Bitter

Can. Pours a cloudy amber color with medium bubbly white head. Aromas come through with tropical and citrus fruit, dank, hints of onion. Flavor had passionfruit, lemon, orange, onion, dank. Bitter. Super tasty beer! Medium body with a sticky texture to it. Lively carbonation and a bitter finish.

Can, courtesy of Jay OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO.Shared with Simon @ Round Tower, Chelmsford.

Loads of onions and tangerines on aroma. Super dry-hopped aroma. Some musty sweatyness. Crisp malt. Juicy big hops. Clean

Can, 8/19, thanks Reynolds314! Pours cloudy Arnold Palmer, medium creamy off white head, great lacing. Aroma is dank, exotic, passionfruit, cat piss, hints of tea. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, mega juicy, dank and delicious. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Yum

Can thanks to Devin. Pours a cloudy golden orange with medium frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit, dank, pine. Medium mouth, juicy, pineapple and mango, dank, crushable, really enjoyed this.

Can thanks to T.J, much thanks! Cloudy Amber in color with just a huge floral and grassy aroma. Notes of citrus. Wow, I could smell it before it reached my nose! 
Mosaic is alive and well in this can! Huge scallion and onion with a lingering grassy note at the back end of the sip. Through the center is some nice juicy citrus notes. Love the juicy texture. Really nicely crafted!

Poured from can thanks Justin Gregoire. Pours golden orange with a nice white head. Aromas of fresh citrus pine hops and slight floral note. Taste is awesome. Juicy dank citrus grapefruit and a well balanced hop finish.

16oz can shared by Chalumeaux, thanks TJ! Pours orange gold with an off white head. Aroma is fantastic! Orange, tangerine, caramel. Taste is super juicy. A bit of caramel up from, then orange juice, grapefruit peel, a bit of scallion too. Nice.

Beer pours a hazy golden with a medium frothy white head that dissipates. Smells a bit floral but mostly heavy piney hops like a heady topper or sip or sunshine. Taste follows as such, you have to like hops to like this beer. If you crave hops sometimes like regularly IPA drinkers usually do, this is top choice. Extremely well hopped mostly piney but also flavors of grapefruit and papaya. Aromatic, medium bodied well carbonated. Hop lovers dream for sure

Poured from can into a tulip: Pours golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of grapefruit, papaya, and other tropical elements with some resin. Taste is heavy tropical hops, very juicy, and a little bitterness at the back end and some resin. Medium body, nice carbonation, light sweetness, this is an awesome IPA. Better than Julius.

Aroma just a little underwhelming. Kind of a piney dankness, but doesnt pop out and entice me like I want IPAs to. Not bad though. This has a wonderful balance of bitter and sweet that I normally experience with higher abv IPAs. I really like that. Quite good.

Can at home. Pour is hazy orange with a decent sized head and sticky lacing. Bright juicy fruit - pineapples, mango, papaya - grassy hops, some biscuit, bubblegum, and lemons in the aroma. Taste is orange peel, papaya, mangoes, lemon drops, mandarin oranges, light grass, marmalade and pineapple with a big bitter finish. Full mouthfeel with high carbonation. Big flavor, yet highly drinkable.

Tasted from Growler. Poured a goldenish color with a small sized off white head. Fruity, pine, citrus, and some dankness. This was very good, but wondering if having HF Susan right before it made it seem a bit tamer.

Another beer capitalizing on the dank mosaic crop going around. Poured golden orange with normal sized foam and lacing. Lots of cheesy and slight onion mosaic dankness. Some light pine and juicy fruit. Solid.

Growler courtesy of Alan and Ryans June 2015 tasting. Pours a bright golden body with white lacing. Aroma is beautiful fruity funk. Mouthfeel is medium and juicy with notes of funky tropical character, funky Nelson, fruity Amarillo and dank stuff. Awesome.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Slightly hazy orange color, moderately fluffy white head. Some orange, mango, and pineapple but the Amarillo is dominant with citrus pith, rind, and seeds unfortunately. Mild to moderately sweet with a gentle bitter follow-through. Fairly juicy, lively, smooth, and finishes cleanly. Between light and medium bodied.

750 mL growler poured into a snifter. Hazy orange body. Big white head. Nice lacing and retention. Strong garlicky mosaic hops and orange juiciness. Well thats tasty. Orange. The mosaic isnt as strong, but cuts the sweet orange happiness. Orange flavor really comes through in the back end. Low bitterness. Really drinkable. Creamy carbonation. Medium body. Absolutely delicious. Makes me feel like Ive never given Julius a fair shake.
One of the most drinkable juicy tree house beers to date. Tropical fruits mango, guava, orange zest, pear, light candy. Taste is dry and bright and quenching. Better then Julius.

750ml growler thanks to Reynolds and Ernesto. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of strong fruity hops like Julius, some light malts, and light dough. Flavor dominated by the strong citrusy and fruity hops. Average texture. A cool beer, basically Julius.
freshly filled growler, released a day early. Great hop explosion. Onion, scallions, citrus, awesome stuff. Sticky resiny body, bitter hoppy finish
